alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Lavaca (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 7:57PM CST until January 28 at 8:07AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Trinity River near Goodrich affecting Liberty, Polk and San Jacinto Counties. Trinity River at Riverside affecting Walker, Trinity, Polk and San Jacinto Counties. West Fork San Jacinto near Conroe affecting Montgomery County. Lake Creek at Sendera Ranch Road affecting Montgomery County. Colorado River at Wharton affecting Wharton and Matagorda Counties. San Bernard River Near East Bernard affecting Austin, Wharton, Fort Bend and Colorado Counties. Navidad River at Strane Park affecting Jackson County. Trinity River near Moss Bluff affecting Chambers and Liberty Counties. Trinity River at Liberty affecting Liberty County. Cypress Creek Near Sharp Road affecting Harris and Fort Bend Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Menard Creek near Rye affecting Liberty, Polk and Hardin Counties. East Fork San Jacinto near New Caney affecting Liberty, Harris and Montgomery Counties. San Jacinto River near Sheldon affecting Harris County. West Fork San Jacinto near Porter affecting Montgomery County. West Fork San Jacinto near Humble affecting Harris and Montgomery Counties. San Bernard River near Sweeny affecting Brazoria County. San Bernard River near Boling affecting Wharton, Fort Bend and Brazoria Counties. Navidad River at Morales affecting Lavaca and Jackson Counties. Navidad River near Speaks affecting Lavaca and Jackson Counties. For the Trinity River...including Crockett, Riverside, Romayor, Goodrich, Liberty, Moss Bluff...Major flooding is forecast. For the Menard Creek...including Rye...Minor flooding is forecast. For the East Fork San Jacinto River...including Cleveland, New Caney...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the West Fork San Jacinto River...including Porter, Sendera Ranch Road, Conroe, Humble, Sheldon...Major flooding is forecast. For the Cypress Creek...including Eldridge Parkway, Mathis Road, Sharp Road, Katy-Hockley Road, Hufmeister Road, Grant Road, Kohrville, Stuebner-Airline Road, Westfield, Kuykendahl Road, Inverness Forest, Cypresswood Drive...Minor flooding is forecast. For the San Bernard River...including East Bernard, Sweeny, Boling... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Navidad River...including Sublime, Speaks, Morales, Strane Park...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Navidad River at Morales. * WHEN...Until Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 34.0 feet, Major lowland flooding begins with several feet of water over the approaches to the County Road 283 bridge and water threatending the bridge floor. The lowest homes in the flood plain are threatened near Vienna and in northern Jackson County. Livestock should be removed from the flood plain from the headwaters to Lake Texana. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Friday the stage was 32.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM CST Friday was 32.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 32.2 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 32.0 feet on 10/17/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Navidad River Morales 29.0 32.0 Fri 7 pm CST 30.2 13.1 12.2 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon at 200 PM CST.
